channel.title: Blogdown on Ample
channel.description: Recent content in Blogdown on Ample

item.title: A Great Blogdown Tutorial
item.description: Yihui Xie wrote a great book on blogdown. However, for an even better tutorial on how to get up and running with a blogdown-based blog, check out this wonderful tutorial by Alison Presmanes Hill.

item.title: Test-Blogdown
item.description: This is a test R blogdown post print("Hello World") ## [1] "Hello World" ## [1] "Hello World without code shown" test <- mtcars %>% group_by(cyl) %>% summarize(AveMpg = mean(mpg)) ggplot(data=test, mapping=aes(x=cyl, y=AveMpg)) + geom_line(stat="identity")

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This sample post is mainly for blogdown users. If you do not use blogdown, you can skip the first section. 1. Markdown or R Markdown This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc.
